choices.A: Another administrator intentionally changed the settings.
choices.D: There is a bug in the current hypervisor version.

questions.question_text: Of ten newly deployed VMs from a single template, the cloud administrator notices one VM has direct root access enabled and automatic configuration control disabled. These settings do not comply with the company's policies for production VMs. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of this situation?

discussion.content: How is this B? The other 9 VMs are fine. Template is not misconfigured. I'm guessing C.
I'm going with A. It seems more like human error than machine error

questions.question_text: A company wants to take advantage of cloud benefits while retaining control of and maintaining compliance with all its security policy obligations. Based on the non-functional requirements, which of the following should the company use?

discussion.content:
For IaaS, PaaS and SaaS, the company could not easily retain control of and maintain compliance with its security policy obligations. For these cloud implementation models, data for example stores within service provider system so the company has very least control of security settings.

For hybrid cloud, the company is able to use the cloud for applications and processing, but keep data on-premises, and data access tightly controlled.

Answer should be A - Hybrid Cloud.

comments.content: nick1970 did you take this exam, if so when, and how did you do? I'm trying to determine how to use this material. The fourm alls for open disscusion and I'm just trying to determine if these responeses to the questions were applied to the real exam and how you did you do? or did the answers that are suggested by the site fare better? I feel comfortable with me research yet I'm trying to weed out the uneccessary information. Just asking as a fellow test taker.

discussion.content: The answer is B. In an Hybrid cloud you can take a private and a public cloud, so for the public cloud part the best option is Iaas
I would go with B as well. in IaaS customer can maintain networking security partly themselves

I think the answer is B. The questions doesn't specify what cloud product they are choosing. So IaaS might satisfy their legal obligations. Either way you look at it, security is shared on all cloud solutions.

choices.D: SaaS, as the cloud provider has less security responsibility
choices.A: Hybrid cloud, as use is restricted to trusted customers
choices.B: IaaS, as the cloud provider has a minimal level of security responsibility
choices.C: PaaS, as the cloud customer has the most security responsibility

questions.question_text: A cloud application has been in production for six months without any issues. Shortly after increasing the number of users assigned to the application, however, users start reporting errors. The administrator does not see any resource thresholds being exceeded in the cloud dashboard. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the errors?

discussion.content: B or C. C more possibility

questions.question_text: A cloud administrator is securing an application hosted by an IaaS provider. The operating system on the VM has been updated. Which of the following should the administrator use to BEST secure the VM from attacks against vulnerable services regardless of operating system?

discussion.content: IDS provides only notification. B and D depend on the OS and the specifically says "regardless of operating system". A Firewall is the only one that's both independent of the OS and offers protection.
Con un firewall puedes permitir o denegar el uso de los servicios, con un IDS no proteges nada, solo recibes posibles alertas de intrusi√≥n

comments.content:
he said: 
With a firewall you can allow or deny the use of services, with an IDS you do not protect anything, you only receive possible intrusion alerts.

choices.A: Document in the change management database.

questions.question_text: A cloud engineer is migrating an application running on an on-premises server to a SaaS solution. The cloud engineer has validated the SaaS solution, as well as created and tested a migration plan. Which of the following should the cloud engineer do before performing the migration? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
Says he has already tested a migration plan.
